context: The word 'otsida' is an Estonian verb meaning 'to look for' or 'to search for'. It's the basic form of the verb. When conjugated, it changes according to the subject and tense: otsin (I look for), otsid (you look for), otsib (he/she/it looks for), otsime (we look for), otsite (you all look for), otsivad (they look for). This verb is commonly used in everyday situations when searching or looking for objects, people, places, or information.
